alert.note: Alert for Blair; Huntingdon; Mifflin; Northern Centre; Southern Centre (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 5:25PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN HUNTINGDON...CENTRAL MIFFLIN...SOUTHWESTERN CENTRE AND NORTHEASTERN BLAIR COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 525 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near State College to near Tyrone to 16 miles north of Altoona. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Tyrone, Stormstown, Bald Eagle, Burnham, Belleville, Warriors Mark, Pine Grove Mills, Yeagertown, Ramblewood, Reedsville, Allensville, Spruce Creek, Birmingham, Franklinville, Whipple Dam State Park, Mcalevys Fort, Rock Springs, Petersburg and Barrville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
